page.title: 20GROVE FARM SANDON CHELMSFORD
page.content: Grove Farm has 307 acres of land. It is both a dairy and an arable farm. Wheat is grown there.They employ two bird scarers to shoot the birds which eat the seed.They have three tractors and a combine harvester.The cows have their calves in the spring and they become upset when their calves are taken away.The cows can live up to eighteen years but the usual age is between ten and fifteen years.They are fed and cleaned out at 6.30 a.m and fed again at 5.30 p.m.The farmer's six hundred pigs are now at East Hanningfield.These are slaughtered when they are at least seventeen weeks old.They are fed on a ration of nuts once a day.Right beside the farmhouse is a woodland area which is kept for wildlife.They do not have hedges around their fields but some fences.
